column4: Hi. I installed the latest Ubuntu, and can someone help me configure the wireless?
thanks.
How do I setup wlan0 interface?
eth0 is properly linked to my network card and it's working..
but wireless lan is not working..
I have already loaded the module for it.
Anyone?
I actually just made a script that send the information needed to iwconfig :)
Also the novell wireless control applet is worth looking at.
open an editor, but #!/bin/bash on the first line, then "sudo iwconfig eth0 your-commands-here" on the second line, then "ifup eth0" or "dhclient eth0" on the third line.
that could be a problem.
Have you tried the network application under "Computer"
the part where I have to put interface wlan0 or eth0 is blank, cna't change it.
thanks btw.. let me know if you can think of something.
what if prism2_usb is called something else already?
how do I check that? thanks
try greping for wlan and eth too
done. nothing interesting..
what should I look for?
I couldn't find anything on google about that error.
does it boot though?
ftp://ftp.linux-wlan.org/pub/linux-wlan-ng/ the FAQ and README have some interesting info... but since I can't test it I don't know how interesting.
